original.definition: be available or ready for a certain function or service

candidates.description: (law) the replacement of one obligation by another by mutual agreement of both parties; usually the replacement of one of the original parties to a contract with the consent of the remaining party (gloss match)
the act of moving smoothly along a surface while remaining in contact with it (gloss match)

a form of solitaire that begins with seven piles of cards with the top cards facing up; descending sequences of cards of alternating colors are built on these piles; as aces become available they are placed above the seven piles; the object is to build sequences in suit from ace to king as the remaining cards are dealt out one at a time (gloss match)
a form of rummy in which a player can go out if the cards remaining in their hand total less than 10 points (gloss match)

game in which matchsticks are arranged in rows and players alternately remove one or more of them; in some versions the object is to take the last remaining matchstick on the table and in other versions the object is to avoid taking the last remaining matchstick on the table (gloss match)
counting backward from an arbitrary number to indicate the time remaining before some event (such as launching a space vehicle) (gloss match)
a takeover bid where the acquirer offers to pay more for the shares needed to gain control than for the remaining shares (gloss match)
continuing or remaining in a place or state (gloss match)
the act of waiting (remaining inactive in one place while expecting something) (gloss match)
a sale intended to dispose of all remaining stock (gloss match)
an indicator of the amount of fuel remaining in a vehicle (gloss match)
the remaining parts of something that has been wrecked (gloss match)
the trait of remaining inactive; a lack of initiative (gloss match)
the trait of remaining calm and seeming not to care; a casual lack of concern (gloss match)
the property of remaining unchanged (gloss match)
the state of remaining awake (gloss match)
food remaining from a previous meal (gloss match)
the dregs remaining after brewing coffee (gloss match)
a short piece remaining on a trunk or stem where a branch is lost (gloss match)
a fugitive remaining in the United States after an immigration judge has ordered them deported (gloss match)
one of four competitors remaining in a tournament by elimination (gloss match)
the phenomenon of floating (remaining on the surface of a liquid without sinking) (gloss match)
a sterile vestigial pistil remaining in a staminate flower (gloss match)

the estate remaining after debts and funeral expenses and administrative expenses have been deducted from the gross estate; the estate then left to be distributed (and subject to federal and state inheritance taxes) (gloss match)

an annuity scheme wherein participants share certain benefits and on the death of any participant his benefits are redistributed among the remaining participants; can run for a fixed period of time or until the death of all but one participant (gloss match)
a form of life insurance whereby on the death or default of a participant his share is distributed to the remaining members (gloss match)
the amount of fuel remaining (gloss match)
a state of surviving; remaining alive (gloss match)
remaining in place (gloss match)
a blood clot formed within a blood vessel and remaining attached to its place of origin (gloss match)
resembling schizophrenia but remaining within the bounds of normality (gloss match)
a synthetic material resembling clay but remaining soft; used as a substitute for clay or wax in modeling (especially in schools) (gloss match)
the soil that is remaining after the soluble elements have been dissolved (gloss match)
the solid matter remaining after oil has been pressed from cottonseeds (gloss match)
